Text.Value: You're holding yourself back. Start over with a blank slate.
What did you do?! My teacher gave me that! And she - and she's dead, you bastard.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The player grabbed the lute and smashed it on the ground. The bard stands up.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Stands up.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player smashed your lute - you're hysterical and furious.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing up.

Text.Value: Look, erm, I really appreciate the help. But I think I should continue on my own. Thanks anyway.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute. Takes the lute back from the player.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The lute twangs and the tiefling stopped singing. She looks awkwardly at you.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting back on the rock.

Text.Value: You'd better swap that lute for a weapon. You'll need one, soon enough.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Puts lute away in magic pocket and starts to cry.

Text.Value: How can I put this? That sounded a little... unpolished.
Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.
No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and start looking at the player.

Text.Value: True. And when you finally perfect a song... there's nothing like it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Face lights up. Sounds truly happy and filled with wonder. Music is what she loves the most in life. It inspires her and gives her hope.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: She was playing her lute. We... didn't hear the gnolls coming.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Catch in her voice. More horrified than on the brink of crying.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I remember waking up one night on the road and seeing her - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Laughs slightly as she thinks of the memory. Love in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: What is wrong with you? You told me you wanted to help!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Player give back the lute to the bard.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Holding her TEACHER's lute. Almost cradling it.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player stole her instrument and then returned it. Upset. Horrified. Betrayed.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: Well, I don't know. Perhaps the lute had it coming.
Look, thank you for returning it, but just - just leave me alone.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dismissal. Backing away almost.
EditorData.NodeContext: Grateful to have it back, but doesn't trust the player. Angry and pleading.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.

Text.Value: I'm not cut out to be a bard. Or much else, if I'm honest.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute. Arms around herself - devastated.
EditorData.NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: But I... maybe you're right. It was broken to begin with.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has told her to start over. Doubting herself. Hurt and confused.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: No. It's mine now.
Tough audience. Those animals weren't shy with their criticisms.
Nod in encouragement and gesture to her lute.
That's terrible.
Where is it? Damn it. No, no!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is standing up from the rock looking around for the other lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing up. Puts OWN lute away. Patting pockets AFTER. Looking around.
EditorData.NodeContext: Panicked.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing up looking for the lute.

Text.Value: It's been so long since I... since...

EditorData.NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry. She hasn't played with anyone since her teacher died. With Lihala's death, she thought her gift of music was gone. Now she realises it was there all along.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting.

Text.Value: I found your lute. Here.
Hm. It can't hurt. What do you have in mind?

EditorData.NodeContext: Hesitant. Wants the help but nervous.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: No need to be sorry. Though it still needs work.
Let me see if I can help.
Lihala said that's why eulogies were important. They were for the living as well as the dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice as she recalls her teacher. Grief as she recalls that the eulogy she was writing was as much for her benefit as well as Lihalas.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - Player and bard playing lute together.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard play together. Scenic shot as the bard closes her eyes and sings - peaceful. When she finishes singing puts away OWN lute in magic pocket. Player also puts the TEACHER'S  lute into their magic pocket at the end.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently sung. Eyes closed.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting.

Text.Value: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] reaches out to grab Alfira's lute., [Alfira] twists out of the way. <Chris>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

Text.Value: That was my teacher's. It's all I - I'm sorry. I have to find it.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing looking for the lute.

Text.Value: Sounds terrible. I'm sorry.
Play along with her.
Thank you. I was having trouble... finding the words.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Choking up slightly. Grateful but also overwhelmed with emotion.

Text.Value: Really? Oh...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: You sound absolutely gutted here - and you look like a kicked puppy. Player has just trashed your song.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Oh. Should I try something else? Be honest.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The player is shacking his head and the bard his holding her lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Looks and sounds like a kicked puppy, but means it when she says be honest.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: stands up. Cue cinematic of her singing. At end of song put lute in magic pocket.

Text.Value: Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - Player and bard playing lute together.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard playing together. Player has a lute. Shot of the two playing in harmony as Alfira closes her eyes - it's a peaceful scene.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently sung.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting.

Text.Value: Sorry, I need to do this on my own.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. She wants to finish the song but it isn't going anywhere.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Urgh. Even animals think I'm terrible. I want to finish this song, but I can't - nothing fits, you know?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated with herself. Doesn't feel good enough.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Perfectly awful. These are the worst lyrics I've ever heard.
Listen closely. I'll show you how to do it right.
Can I help?
This song will be the death of me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with self.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock, breaks off playing the lute.

Text.Value: This is embarrassing. Gods.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: You want honesty? Give up - you don't have the makings of a bard.
Continue to play.
...when you call the last light down...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently and sadly singing. Feeling out the words.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and playing the lute.

Text.Value: What's the matter?
Are you all right?
Leave me alone. I mean it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing. Holding lute close.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player stole but then returned her instrument. She's a little afraid and just wishes to be left alone.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: That's the first time I've played since Lihala died. My teacher.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Words of mine will turn to ash...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher. Getting excited.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and playing the lute.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground. <Chris>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.

Text.Value: It was right here. Someone must have taken it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing. looking around frantically. Gesturing in a 'wtf' fashion.
EditorData.NodeContext: Her teacher's lute is missing. It means the world to her and she's heartbroken and angry that someone would take it. Also blames herself for not keeping a better eye on it.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing.

Text.Value: Get the hells away from me.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turnings away - furious
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Starting to cry. Angry and upset.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock and cry.

Text.Value: Gesture for her to continue.
My teacher, Lihala. She loved dancing. Had two left feet, mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Thanks. I'll need it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad smile in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Don't worry. Cry as much as you need.
Heh. Thanks.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together.
EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has complimented her music. She's calming down after getting upset.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Moon... moon reminds me of your grace...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Very gently singing. Not playing.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Yes. Yes!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Excited. You have the line and are holding the entirety of the song in your head - and you have to sing it or it will disappear.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and stop playing the lute.

Text.Value: All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock. Playing the lute with the player.

Text.Value: First things first - what's the song about?
Never mind. This isn't going anywhere.
Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is singing and playing the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock, not looking at the player, playing the lute.

Text.Value: I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard take the lute back in her hands.
EditorData.NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: And that's exactly what I'm going to do: finish The Weeping Dawn - for her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined. This is her chance to take back control in her life.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Keep the lute. Please. You've earned it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Big smile - cheerful and grateful
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Sorry.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hiding her face as she cries, struggling to get herself under control.
EditorData.NodeContext: Face crumples as she begins bawling her eyes out. Cover her face. Embarassment in her voice as she tries to stop crying.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: It's all right. Let it all out.
That was terrible. I'll show you how it's done.
But when you're stuck, and it's just getting worse - ugh.

EditorData.NodeContext: Crumples. Frustrated.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Hand me that lute. We can perform together.
This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.
Sorry, do you mind? You've given me a lot to think about.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hurt and confused.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: It refers to a night on the road with my teacher, Lihala. I was fast asleep when I heard a noise.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher and her terrible dancing.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I should start sketching out ideas. Thank you for the help, I guess.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to sound thankful but kind of failing.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Here. I don't have time for this.
The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to her. Thank you. I... I needed this.

EditorData.NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has refused to return her teacher's lute. Upset. Horrified. In tears.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: Consider this a lesson - don't be careless.
Besides, I'm not doing this for me. This is for the people I... we lost on the way here. It's important.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I... we lost people on the way here.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Words of mine will - urgh.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is singing and playing the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. Sings the opening.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock playing the lute.

Text.Value: Heh. She'd have said the same thing.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together.
EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

EditorData.stateContext: Stand up. Holding your lute close.

Text.Value: There was so much blood. I - I can still smell it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Horrified. Grieving.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Change? No. DAMN IT.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to make 'change' fit. Considering tone. Dammit is a curse as she dramatically yells. Angry at herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Say nothing.
I started fresh with that song.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is playing some strings with the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: All right - that's what your lyrics need to say.
Thanks. Lihala made me love music: the sound, the feel, the thrill. But when she died... it was gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Love and sincerity in her voice at the thought of her teacher.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Who's the song about?
The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to Lihala. I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard take the lute back in her hands.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Put her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: That song was beautiful. Worthy of a few tears.
Until now. I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch in my fingers to perfect a song.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hope and excitement.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Haha. Very subtle.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together.
EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has made a show of looking away and not crowding her when she's upset. It's made her laugh.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Dance upon the stars tonight... Smile and pain will fade away...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player is holding the lute - ready to begin playing.
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently sung.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: ...by slowly killing it with this song. Urgh. I can't... nothing fits, you know?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated. Embarassed.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: What?! Is it - ? No scratches, strings seem intact...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking over the lute to make sure it's okay.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player returned her lute. Surprised. Suspicious. Checking the instrument.
EditorData.SFXTags: One or two lute string sound to see if the lute is working.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is now holding the lute.

Text.Value: This song is for Lihala... my teacher. She - she died on the way here. I need to get this right.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I should never have let it out of my sight. I'm an idiot.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.
EditorData.NodeContext: Almost on the brink of tears at the thought of the missing lute. Feels stupid. Like it's her fault and she's nothing but useless.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.

Text.Value: Can I help you finish the song?
Heh. She'd yell at me for that clunky verse. And make me play 'til my fingers were raw.

EditorData.NodeContext: Recalling how her teacher would yell at her. Fondness and love in her voice, It's a nice memory.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Slip the lute into your pack.
Well, would you look at this grove. So lovely. So... grove-like.
And thank you - for everything.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Love and grief.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Hm. It can't hurt. I have her... I have an extra lute, if you want?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Hesitates at 'her'. This is her teacher's lute (who died on the way here). Needs the help and is looking for companionship while playing. Sounds unsure of herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: It was my teacher's. And it's - it's all I have left.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing next to the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has asked about the missing lute. She's upset and angry.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is still standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: All the love I can't repay...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I haven't finished a song since Lihala died. Haven't played at all, if I'm honest.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gripping lute tightly.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I take it back. What you're doing is perfect.
That's the creative process for you. Agony and ecstasy. Mostly agony.
More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard put the lute next to her.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustrated
EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.
Fine. Take it.
Violence doesn't fix everything, you know. Music can help in ways a silly blade can't.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has insulted your instrument and told you to pick up a blade. 'the silly blade' is a play on what the player said to you.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.
And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Wait.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute qand stop playing.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Moment she realises she has the song within her grasp. Excited.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and stop playing the lute.

EditorData.stateContext: Stands up. No lute in hands.

Text.Value: Leave.
I woke up, and there she was - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I don't usually - I'm all right.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Guess I'll see what Baldur's Gate brings.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Sing: 'Words of mine will turn to ash...'

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: This a quiet scene of colloboration between two musicians -

Text.Value: No. I mean - yes.

EditorData.NodeContext: No is sad sadly, and then she barks a yes realising she's answered it wrong. Embarassed,
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Please. It was my teacher's. I don't have - I need it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Panic. Grief.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: It's a bad song, plain and simple.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] hands the lute back to Alfira. <Chris>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player hands the lute back to her.

Text.Value: You're right. She'd have said the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: Love and a smile in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Stay silent and listen.

EditorData.stateContext: Standing. Holding her teacher's lute close to her chest.

Text.Value: You think I don't know that?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has insulted her music. She's embarassed and frustrated with herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Keep going. What would you say to your teacher if she were here right now?
It was awful. I couldn't look at a lute without hearing her - screaming.

EditorData.NodeContext: Horrified.  Clearly traumitised as she recalls the death of her teacher. Her teacher's death prevented her from playing music again.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: You already have an instrument. Why do you need another?
It was just a joke. Here's your lute.
*Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within despairs at your kindness.*
Best of luck with that.
Heh. And then some. But I have the bones of the song - and that's what matters.

EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has told her the song needs work. She laughs as she agrees. Hope and determination.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Why would someone do that? Why would someone destroy my lute?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.logicalname: Lute was broken by other player

Text.Value: The song's more important than survival? Fine - it's your life.
Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is singing and playing the lute, the player join her a bit.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player in surprise, brow furrowed as she closes her eyes and sings then line - then a big smile as her eyes light up. She loves the line and turns to the player for the next.
EditorData.NodeContext: Surprise but joy as she sings in response to the player.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock. Starting to play the lute again.

Text.Value: And I'm sticking to it. Thank you ever so much.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard takes the lute back in her hands
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has been condescending about her decision to play. She's determined and saracastic in her thanks.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.
Let me help you finish it, then.
I'm trying to finish this bloody song. And it's not... nothing fits, you know?

EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Heh. Yes, it's led quite a life of crime. I'm simply putting it out of its misery...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Laughs. Playing along with the player's jokes about her lute.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I just wanted to - to thank her. To honour her, you know? And now I'll never finish her eulogy.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Griefing - upset. On the brink of crying.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: *Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within churns - she sickens you.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player puts lute into magic pocket.

Text.Value: My teacher always said a good musician never demands a solo.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has offered to 'show her how it was done'. Snarky and offended.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I'm not going to ask where you got this. Just... thank you. Now, please leave.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is holding the teacher's lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.
EditorData.NodeContext: Suspects the player had something to do with it. Doesn't want to know. Just wants to be left alone with her lute. Doesn't want the trouble.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.

Text.Value: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is singing and playing the lute.The player is following her moves.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Starts singing again with the new lyrics
EditorData.NodeContext: Sadness in her voice as she sings.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock. Playing the lute.

Text.Value: Sorry. Damn it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The bard is sitting on the rock and the player put the lute back in his pocket.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Bursts into tears. Upset. Embarassed and grieving.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I wanted to write a song for her and you - you ruined it. You ruined everything.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Break down crying.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock, with the smashed lute next to her on the ground.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Gives lute to Alfira. <Chris>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player gives lute to Alfira.

Text.Value: I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch to perfect a song.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hope returning to her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: You're welcome. Just keep at it.
How could you break it?! I hope - I hope you're ripped apart by gnolls, you beast.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.logicalname: Lute was broken by this player.

Text.Value: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: That... that it's okay. That I'll be okay.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has asked what she wants to say to her teacher (who has died). She's trying to express that she doesn't want her teacher to worry about her. That she'll do her best. And that she loves her.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Wait - what are you doing? Give that back! Right now!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Player put the lute into his pocket.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Aflira puts her OWN lute into her magic pocket and frantically stands up.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has just stolen her teacher's mandolin. Panic. It's the only thing she has of her teacher. Upset.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: It sounded like a cat being strangled. Godsdammit.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: To sing outward, one must look inward. Why are you writing the song?
There's no singing voice that could save those lyrics. You know that, right?
Really? I... I love music.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Been told to give up her dream. Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Oh. All right. I mean - thanks anyway.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - Player give back the lute to the bard.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looks down at mandolin.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sad and dissappointed but trying to hide it.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: Really? Good. That's good. Let's keep going.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Player has told her what she's doing works. She's almost talking to herself in reassurance.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: I shouldn't have let that lute out of my sight. I'm an idiot.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Someone stole her lute. It was all she had left of her teacher's. She feels stupid and like it's her fault.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.logicalname: Other player stole lute in dialog

Text.Value: The animals agreed. Why else do you think they left?
Leave me be. I'm in the middle of something.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing - lute
EditorData.NodeContext: Stern but friendly.
EditorData.logicalname: Bard is currently out of context

Text.Value: It's still rough, but my song is getting there!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Her song is on the way to being finished. Happy and full of hope - thought she'd never player again.
EditorData.SFXTags: Some lute strings sound for the test.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: But I can't even finish this one song...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Doubting herself.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: You really should be more careful.
Lihala. My teacher. And friend.

EditorData.NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting.

Text.Value: I'll start from the beginning. We'll take it slow.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Alfira] Passes teacher's lute to Player. <Chris>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.NodeContext: Encouraging tone. She's thrilled someone will play music with her again.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.
Continue singing: 'Moon reminds me of your grace...'
And I have no time for amateurs. Thanks.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turn away in dismissal.
EditorData.NodeContext: Curshing dismissal. Sarcastic.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and turning away from the player.

Text.Value: What's that tune you're singing?
Heh. She'd yell at me for that metre. And make me play it over and over again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Maybe the life of a bard just isn't for you.
Get the hells away from me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Upset. Horrified.

Text.Value: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.
Thinking of it now - my heart hurts and my words just seem to crumble... like ash.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Don't come near me. I mean it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Upset. Angry. And a little scared. Player stole her lute and she wants nothing to do with them.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.
EditorData.logicalname: This player stole lute in dialog

Text.Value: I haven't, well, come up with anything yet. But I'm sure it'll come to me... eventually.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Thank goodness. I feel like I'm so close. Let me try again.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.

Text.Value: Let's start with the lyrics. Dance upon the stars tonight?
What did that poor instrument ever do to you? You're butchering it.
Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.
Get the hells away from me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.
EditorData.NodeContext: Angry.

Text.Value: Wait. That's it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>

Text.Value: That was... interesting. Why don't we try again?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The bard is holding the lute.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Clanging sound as the player messes up - fingers banging against the lute. Bard winces in almost pain at the sound.
EditorData.CinematicObjects: Bard's lute and bard's teacher lute.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is standing next to the rock.

Text.Value: I... I thought they were cheering me on.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Sounds dejected. Surpised and sad.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock.

Text.Value: Keep time with her.
Wait. Words of mine will turn to ash... That's perfect.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: <placeholder>
EditorData.NodeContext: Excited. Inspiration is starting to return.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The bard is sitting on the rock and start to play some string.

Text.Value: Sounds terrible. I'm sorry.
Finding the words is an important part of being a singer, you know.
Forget what I said. You're doing just fine.

Synopsis:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
